page.title: 20TRANSPORT BEULAH-GARTH
page.content: Central Wales Line from Shrewsbury to Llanelli. 5 diesel trains, usually of 2 or 3 coaches, daily in each direction. Unmanned halt at Garth, trains stop on request, tickets on train. Buses owned by R.Brown run Monday market service,two trips from Llanwrtyd,via Beulah, Llangammarch and Garth to Builth. Post bus - mini bus owned by Post Office, carries 12 passengers and collects mail, two trips daily between Llanwrtyd and Builth. Single fare Garth - Builth 40p. Most families have one car, many two, used for transport to work. Farms have vans and landrovers. All young people and up to 70% of women drive. Roads well maintained by Powys C.C. Farmers responsible for private roads to farms.
